description: From cacūmin- (the stem of the Latin cacūmen (“extremity, point, peak”) + -al.

adjectives.description: cacuminal (comparative more cacuminal, superlative most cacuminal)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to a point, top, or crown.
(linguistics, phonology) Pronounced using a retroflexed tongue.
examples: /L/ and /n/, slightly more cacuminal than the alveolar series, are very rare, and occur only in word-final position.

entries.meaning: (linguistics, phonology) A sound pronounced using a retroflexed tongue.
